title: Basic Verb Conjugation
description: Practice conjugating common -er verbs in the present tense.
learningObjectives: Identify the stem of an -er verb.
Apply the correct present tense endings for -er verbs.
explanation: To conjugate regular -er verbs in the present tense, remove the -er ending to find the stem, and then add the appropriate ending: -e, -es, -e, -ons, -ez, -ent.

exercises.instruction: Fill in the blank with the correct form of the verb in parentheses.
exercises.feedback: Remember to match the verb ending with the subject pronoun.

commonMistakes: Forgetting that 'ils/elles' uses the '-ent' ending, which is silent.
